Package communication

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • communication.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Protocol, java.lang.Runnable
    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Protocol
    ClientHandler class for use in Spectrangle game.

    2019.01.30
    Author:
    Corjan van den Brink (based on code template from Theo Ruys), Arne de Roode

        public boolean inRoom

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientHandler

        public ClientHandler​(Server serverArg,
                     java.net.Socket sockArg)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a ClientHandler object and initializes both Data streams.
        Parameters:
        serverArg - The server for the ClientHandler
        sockArg - Server's connection socket to the client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failing to create the in/out streams

    • Method Detail

      • features

        public void features()
        Method for handling the sending and receiving of features at the initialization of the Server Client connection.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method takes care of sending messages from the Client. Every message that is received, is handled here. If a client is not responding, the method concludes that the socket connection is broken and shutdown() will be called.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
        This method can be used to send a message over the socket connection to the Client. If the writing of a message fails, the method concludes that the socket connection has been lost and shutdown() is called.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to send to client

      • getRoom

        public Room getRoom()
        Getter for room.
        Returns:
        room

      • getClientName

        public java.lang.String getClientName()
        Gets the name of the client (default this.toString()).
        Returns:
        useful and pretty unique or Client set string
